posts.content:
Hi all new to this forum,
How do I tell if my splitscreen is a SO42?
Its a 1967 USA import. On the plate on the top of the roof (inside) it has typ 23-42
Number is 237113954.
It also has another plate behind the passenger seat. 19 4
Then 430 842 025 056 097 108
Then UT 2312 523907 7113954. It was shipped with no interior. Has bulkhead so you cant walkthough. slated windows.
Any help would be great.
Tonenee50.

author.location: Off the shoulder of Orion, watching C-beams glitter in the dark near the Tannhauser Gate

posts.content:
You can find how to translate your plates here...
http://www.thesamba.com/vw/archives/info/id.php

I won't spoil the fun...

You have found the details you require to translate the basis build details as made...
As to how and where you find the Westy ID...
others will help...

author.location: Off the shoulder of Orion, watching C-beams glitter in the dark near the Tannhauser Gate

posts.content:
err what does the plate 2342 refer to then?
boyblue wrote: Paint color L87 -  Pearl white
Interior color (doorpanels and seats) *** Unknown ***
Destination Picked up by first owner at the factory in Germany, meant for US-market
The 5 23 907
are westfalia 5 export code and 23 does refer to kombi..907 is pearl white

So it was ordered by Westfalia!

Many thanks for all the info on the bus!!

Tonenee50.
